faqSection.title: Frequently Asked Questions About Buying a House in Sector 48 Gurugram
faqSection.description: Get detailed answers to common queries regarding property types, legal considerations, pricing, and infrastructure development in Sector 48.

faqs.question: What types of residential properties are most common when you buy house in Sector 48
faqs.answer: Sector 48 primarily features independent houses, bespoke villas, and modern builder floors. Builder floors are particularly popular, ranging from 2 BHK to spacious 4 BHK units, often equipped with premium amenities like dedicated parking and private lift access. Independent houses provide larger plots and customization opportunities, appealing to buyers seeking greater autonomy over their living space and design.

faqs.question: How does the connectivity of Sector 48 compare to other Gurugram sectors
faqs.answer: Sector 48 boasts superior connectivity due to its location right off the Sohna Road and its easy access to the Golf Course Extension Road. It provides quicker routes towards Gurgaon and Manesar compared to western sectors. The sector benefits from strong public transport links, including shared auto services and proximity to the HUDA City Centre Metro Station, making it highly desirable for commuting residents.

faqs.question: Is Sector 48 a good long-term investment location for residential property
faqs.answer: Absolutely Sector 48 is considered an excellent long-term investment. Its mature infrastructure, proximity to commercial IT hubs, and limited availability of large development parcels ensure sustained demand. Historical data shows consistent capital appreciation, making it a reliable sector for investors looking for stability and growth in the Gurugram real estate market.

faqs.question: What is the typical price range for a builder floor in Sector 48 Gurugram
faqs.answer: The price range for builder floors in Sector 48 varies significantly based on the plot size, construction quality, and floor level. Generally, a modern 3 BHK builder floor can start from approximately INR 15 Crores and go up to INR 35 Crores or more for premium specifications on larger plots. Prices are highly dynamic, so consulting current market listings is recommended.

faqs.question: Are the properties in Sector 48 RERA registered
faqs.answer: While individual residential plots and resale independent houses may not be RERA-registered, most new builder floor projects and large-scale residential developments must adhere to RERA guidelines. We verify the RERA status of all applicable new listings to ensure compliance and provide buyers with the maximum protection and transparency throughout the transaction process.

faqs.question: What are the common plot sizes available in Sector 48 for building a house
faqs.answer: Residential plots in Sector 48 are commonly available in standard sizes like 4 Marla, 6 Marla, 8 Marla, and 10 Marla (1 Marla is approximately 272 square feet). These sizes cater to diverse housing needs, from compact luxury homes to expansive villas. The availability of larger plots like 12 Marla and 14 Marla is scarcer but highly sought after.

faqs.question: Are there green spaces and parks available for residents in Sector 48
faqs.answer: Yes Sector 48 is known for being a well-planned sector with dedicated parks and green belt areas. The local development authority ensures adequate provision for recreational spaces, walking tracks, and communal parks, contributing positively to the overall quality of life and providing necessary relief from urban density.

faqs.question: What sort of maintenance charges should I expect after buying a house here
faqs.answer: Maintenance charges vary depending on the specific society or the type of property you purchase. For properties within gated communities or builder floor complexes with amenities like lifts, security, and power backup, expect monthly charges that cover common area upkeep, security services, and infrastructure maintenance. These costs are typically very reasonable given the premium services offered.

faqs.question: How important is documentation verification when buying property in Sector 48
faqs.answer: Documentation verification is critically important. Ensuring the property has a clear title, is free from encumbrances, and has all necessary municipal approvals (like occupancy certificates) prevents future legal disputes. We facilitate thorough legal vetting for every listing, guaranteeing a safe and secure purchase experience for our clients looking to buy house in Sector 48.

faqs.question: Are there any upcoming infrastructure projects that will benefit Sector 48
faqs.answer: Yes Ongoing infrastructure improvements, particularly along the Sohna Road and the potential future metro extensions, are set to further enhance connectivity and property values in Sector 48. These developments confirm the government's focus on improving transport and reducing congestion, significantly benefiting existing and future homeowners.
